'''Wuala''' is a [[Online storage|social distributed file-system-like online storage]] that allows both [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[Linux]] and [[Macintosh|Mac]] users to save files online. Data is encrypted locally and than distributed over wuala users' hard drives using encrypted connections and P2P mechanisms. Wuala ships a java application which needs to be started to use the service. File system integration under Linux is possible using [[NFS]].
+
'''Wuala''' is a [[Online storage|social distributed file-system-like online storage]] that allows both [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[Linux]] and [[Macintosh|Mac]] users to save files online. Data is encrypted locally and than distributed over wuala users' hard drives using encrypted connections and P2P mechanisms. Wuala ships a java application which needs to be started to use the service. File system integration under Linux is possible using [[Network file system|NFS]].
On their website it is said Wuala uses [[Cryptree]]<ref>"Cryptree: A Folder Tree Structure for Cryptographic File Systems" by Grolimund et al. http://www.dcg.ethz.ch/publications/srds06.pdf</ref> encryption employing AES-128 and RSA-2048<ref>FAQ entry at http://wua.la/en/support/faq/c/20#id002003</ref>.
On their website it is said Wuala uses [[Cryptree]]<ref>"Cryptree: A Folder Tree Structure for Cryptographic File Systems" by Grolimund et al. http://www.dcg.ethz.ch/publications/srds06.pdf</ref> encryption employing AES-128 and RSA-2048<ref>FAQ entry at http://wua.la/en/support/faq/c/20#id002003</ref>.
